An intern leaked half the private key from our RSA-encrypted message. Can you exploit the partial exposure to recover the original text from 7283127174383794730212997965045749224857830191070146536906292811016952147610589772648749248878518271382334682170902009243842958144714984259538293688259215?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8470706034399882228600079393192345798946932345977226789605936694799917592848374535130811474083076168756548698798011851456656629724050917357703804532783363, e=7098291348890967866961316047019985435982500860159601259290879042473641119327823766285556349865416855547100753870009779550602746616589893707607146213364109, partial_p=12338517951554524179

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{2sxnh2ky}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 7283127174383794730212997965045749224857830191070146536906292811016952147610589772648749248878518271382334682170902009243842958144714984259538293688259215
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8470706034399882228600079393192345798946932345977226789605936694799917592848374535130811474083076168756548698798011851456656629724050917357703804532783363, e=7098291348890967866961316047019985435982500860159601259290879042473641119327823766285556349865416855547100753870009779550602746616589893707607146213364109, partial_p=12338517951554524179
extra_info: p=77450132445802617219174604799924790183529788288477121088491892537456236559167, q=109369806957108040078813863834964406430839665685432466080720935897413493302589, Ï†(n)=8470706034399882228600079393192345798946932345977226789605936694799917592848187715191408563425778180287913809601397482002682720136881704529268934802921608
